message: What does First Glass of Arkansas specialize in?
completion: Glazing installation, aluminum composite material panels (ACM), fabrication and framing (mainly Kawneer systems), door systems, drafting & submittals, and estimating.

message: What kind of projects does First Glass of Arkansas work on?
completion: Retail, office buildings, schools and universities, medical facilities and hospitals, and government or municipal buildings.

message: Who is the owner of First Glass?
completion: Tiffin Hubbard. Email: Tiffin@FirstGlassAR.com

message: Who is the Senior Project Manager at First Glass?
completion: Nat Long. Email: Nat@FirstGlassAR.com

message: What does 'stile' refer to on doors?
completion: It refers to the width of the vertical section of the door, not the thickness.

message: What are the different stile types and their dimensions?
completion: 500 Series – Wide Stile: 5”, 350 Series – Medium Stile: 3 ½”, 190 Series – Narrow Stile: 2 ⅛”

message: When are openback door frames required?
completion: Always request openback door frames when sidelites are present.

message: How should Kawneer doors be ordered depending on hinge type?
completion: Rabbeted for continuous hinges, beveled for butt hinges or offset pivots.

message: Where are glass stops located in storefront?
completion: At the head of the storefront.

message: What is the labor rate for estimating?
completion: $65.00 per hour.

message: What is the markup on First Glass projects?
completion: 30-35% standard markup.

message: What tax rate should be used in bids?
How is caulking estimated for storefront and curtainwall?
completion: Storefront: 3/8" x 3/8", 200' per case; Curtainwall: 1/2" x 3/8", 150' per case. Add 10% for waste. Use backer rod. Caulk is in 20 oz sausages, 16 per case.

message: What sealant does First Glass use?
completion: Dow CWS or Dow 795, depending on project spec.

message: How should questions be handled during estimating?
completion: Ask the project manager who assigned the bid if the AI assistant cannot help.

message: What is the price for installing windload anchors?
completion: $100/hour for labor, $9 per anchor for material. One anchor per slab line per vertical mullion.

message: How are email quote requests sent to Tristar for glass?
completion: Send to Blake Neafus at BlakeN@tristarglass.com. Include project name, bid date, and attach specs/block sizes.

message: How are quote requests for hardware sent?
completion: Send to Cheryl First at Cheryl.first@imlss.com. Include door schedule, bid date, and hardware spec.

message: What are standard storefront frame dimensions?
completion: Width: 4 ½ inches, Depth: 2 inches.

message: What is the cost for mobilization?
completion: $1,500.00, depending on project complexity.

message: What additional percentage should be added for glass breakage?
What should be included in the bid proposal?
completion: Scope of work, base bid, alternates, clarifications, exclusions, payment terms, lead times, and PDF export.

message: What is the format of the bid email subject line?
completion: "Bid – [Project Name] – First Glass of Arkansas"

message: What’s the standard admin cost added to bids?
What is the lift cost if frame height >12ft or on 2nd floor?
completion: $3,000/month for 65’ boom lift, $200 for pickup, $200 for delivery.

message: Who is the contact for shop drawing pricing?
completion: Luke VanWyck, email: luke@advantagedrafting.com
